column4: I have a question about using Ubuntu Pitivi to edit Windows videos, I open it from the 'host' mount, and the video runs fine after installing H.264 decoder, but it has noa udio
I have a question about using Ubuntu Pitivi to edit Windows videos, I open it from the 'host' mount, and the video runs fine after installing H.264 decoder, but it has no audio
Open the video in totem and it should prompt you to install the needed audio codec.
where do I find totem? I just installed Ubuntu for the first time like an hour ago, excuse my noobiness
It's the actual name of "Movie Player" which is installed by default.
actually.. I did, that's why it prompted me to install the h.264 decoder, I did that but it only has the video. It gave no suggestions on other codecs
I assume other audio does play?
What audo codec does VLC say the video uses?
audio is MPEG AAC audio, Stereo, 44100 Hz
What happens when you try to open this sample aac audio file in totem http://www.nch.com.au/acm/sample.aac ?
how do I open it in totem? It works fine in the browser, if that matters at all
Download it and open it in "Movie Player". To do it in the terminal would be "cd /tmp/ && wget http://www.nch.com.au/acm/sample.aac && totem sample.aac"
I put that in the terminal and nothing happens. Where would it save to?
There was no output at all from the commands I gave?
